intro: Sida magnifica, commonly known as the beautiful sida, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its showy, purple-to-pink flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant has alternate, ovate leaves with a rough texture and is often found in coastal or sandy soils. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Sida magnifica is typically a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters.
